intro: Astrotrichilia, commonly known as the star-tailed orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which features a dense cluster of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Astrotrichilia typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, creeping stem and hairy leaves. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within the orchid family.
